etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin miraculum ‘object of wonder’, from mirari ‘to wonder’, from mirus ‘wonderful’

definitions: a surprising and welcome event that is not explicable by natural or scientific laws and is therefore considered to be the work of a divine agency

examples.text: the miracle of rising from the grave

shortDefinitions: extraordinary and welcome event that is not explicable by natural or scientific laws

definitions: a highly improbable or extraordinary event, development, or accomplishment that brings very welcome consequences

examples.text: it was a miracle that more people hadn't been killed or injured

shortDefinitions: remarkable event or development that brings very welcome consequences

definitions: an amazing product or achievement, or an outstanding example of something

examples.text: a machine which was a miracle of design

shortDefinitions: exceptional product or achievement, or outstanding example of something
